newsitem.title: USA: Stanley Roth named as State Dept's Asia secretary.
newsitem.headline: Stanley Roth named as State Dept's Asia secretary.

text.p: President Bill Clinton on Friday nominated Stanley Roth, a former National Security Council official, as assistant secretary of state for East Asian and Pacific affairs, the White House announced.
If confirmed by the Senate, Roth will replace Winston Lord, who retired in January.
Roth, whose nomination had long been expected, headed Asia policy at the NSC from March 1994 to Jan. 1, 1996. Since then he has been a researcher at the U.S. Institute of Peace, a private think-tank.
White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry called him "a very capable and skilled foreign policy expert on Asian affairs".

Meanwhile the Senate on Friday confirmed two other State Department nominations: Thomas Pickering, former ambassador to Moscow, as Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, replacing Peter Tarnoff; and Stuart Eizenstat, Under Secretary of Commerce for International Trade, as Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, replacing Joan Spero.
Both appointments were approved by unanimous consent, without a recorded vote.
